text: - My name is Luis,

and I'm an Engineering
Operations Technician at AWS.

When I applied for the
internship, honestly,

I didn't really know
what I was getting into.
My background is in bioengineering.
I have some tech experience,
but I didn't really have any knowledge
of what a data center was.
I'd imagine that there were a lot
of computers in data centers,

but I didn't really know
about the infrastructure
around it or how anything really worked.
The ability to learn
is one of the most important things
that I had from my education before.

Nobody understands
everything that we're doing,
but it's important to understand how
to solve the problems that we're facing,
and how to find the resources
when you don't know.
The Work Based Learning Program basically
has us doing classes some of the time,

and then actually getting
hands-on experience

with people who are doing the
work the rest of the time.
So it's a great way to learn about things

and actually see it applied
in your everyday work.

You don't have to be a
student to join the program.
You just have to really wanna learn
and be willing to seize that opportunity.
So during my internship, I noticed
that we actually have discounts
on the exams for AWS certifications.
And I went ahead

and did the Solutions
Architect exam on my own.
I can use the knowledge that I gained

from the Solutions
Architect certification.

I still feel like I'll be
able to apply what I learned

in bioengineering, and
the mindset that I gained

from that education into
these new opportunities.

This internship is a great
way to start your career.
Honestly, like, the opportunities
once you're in AWS are limitless.

Anything that you want to
do, there's a way to do it.
